## 1. Binomial Distribution

```{r}
set.seed(1)
binom_data <- rbinom(n = 1000, size = 5, prob = 0.3)
table(binom_data)

# Probability of exactly 3 successes
dbinom(3, size = 5, prob = 0.3)

# Cumulative probability of ≤ 3 successes
pbinom(3, size = 5, prob = 0.3)
```

## 2. Chi-Square Test using HairEyeColor

```{r}
hair_eye <- as.data.frame(HairEyeColor)
table_data <- xtabs(Freq ~ Hair + Eye, data = hair_eye)

# Chi-square test
chisq.test(table_data)

# Visualize
barplot(table_data, beside = TRUE, legend = TRUE, col = rainbow(4))
```

---

## 3. Student’s t-Distribution

```{r}
set.seed(2)
group1 <- rnorm(10, mean = 50, sd = 5)
group2 <- rnorm(10, mean = 55, sd = 5)

# Two-sample t-test
t.test(group1, group2)

# Visual comparison
hist(group1, col = "skyblue", main = "Group 1", xlim = c(40, 65))
hist(group2, col = "orange", main = "Group 2", xlim = c(40, 65))
```

---

## 4. F-Distribution / ANOVA

```{r}
set.seed(3)
groupA <- rnorm(10, mean = 70)
groupB <- rnorm(10, mean = 75)
groupC <- rnorm(10, mean = 80)
group <- factor(rep(c("A", "B", "C"), each = 10))
scores <- c(groupA, groupB, groupC)

anova_result <- aov(scores ~ group)
summary(anova_result)
```

## 5. Poisson, Exponential, Weibull

```{r}
set.seed(4)

# Poisson
pois_data <- rpois(100, lambda = 3)
hist(pois_data, col = "lightblue", main = "Poisson (λ = 3)", xlab = "Count")

# Exponential
exp_data <- rexp(100, rate = 0.5)
hist(exp_data, col = "lightgreen", main = "Exponential (rate = 0.5)", xlab = "Time")

# Weibull
weib_data <- rweibull(100, shape = 1.5, scale = 5)
hist(weib_data, col = "salmon", main = "Weibull", xlab = "Time")
```
